revised_title: Discovery of a New Genus of Pelagic Gasteropoda: Jasonilla
tldr: The author, John Denis Macdonald, describes a new genus of pelagic Gasteropoda called Jasonilla, characterized by ciliated cephalic appendages and a transparent, cartilaginous shell. The species, Jasonilla mileayiana, was found between Port Jackson and the Isle of Pines. The article provides a detailed anatomical analysis of the organism, including its shell, ciliated arms, mouth, tentacles, foot, creeping disc, gill, and otolithes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
